lines.text: How about my wife's pair? Fantastic, aren't they? I think they're the best looking ones here.
Richard, you are drunk and silly!
He's right! They're really beautiful! Are they very old?
*Pardon*?
Oh, forgive my wife. She's blind drunk! Honey, she wants to know if the *earrings* are very old.
Oh! No, I just bought them. Thank you.
What is that?
What?
There is something *alive* in your blouse!
Oh, Richard. Are they really that noticeable?
Noticeable? They are leaping out in the air and chinning themselves.
Richard, I can't go up there. Everyone's going to notice them.
Don't be ridiculous! The guest list includes Norman Mailer, Bernard Kalman and Saul Bellow. You'd have to be stark naked and bald to get a second look!
[repeated line]
Take a good look, Richard. This is what I am. Do you still want me for your wife?

[taking notes for a prospective blood donor]
Have you ever had hepatitis?
No.
Have you ever had venereal disease?
Well... how would you classify syphilis?
I'd classify it as a venereal disease.
Oh... you know I think I did have hepatitis.

[talking to a musician for a Shakespeare production]
The sitar is... it's interesting. But can you tell me what a sitar has to do with a play set in Denmark?
What do you mean you can't find anything to replace Richard's blood? What are you giving him in its place? Tomato soup?
A man goes into the hospital to have a mole removed and lapses into a coma. What happens when you come here for something serious? Do you develop a mole?
Nobody listens to a woman. They'd just think you were making it with me.
Hey, you've gone soft! You bought the hamsters.
No, I have not gone soft. I just want to be sure that if I die, I will generate enough guilt in my kids to drive them into analysis.

[door bell rings]
Darlene, answer the door!
[bell rings again]
Darlene, the door!
[bell rings again]
Darlene, the door! Oy, why did they abolish slavery?

[peaking her head in the door]
Your brasierre is showing, Mrs. Messinger!

[haughtily, in a loin cloth at a New York rooftop party]
You liked my novel? I was surprised when it sold. I didn't write it for that. Anyway, I've been elected head of this new cultural committee. I flew to Washington last week. I didn't want to go, God knows... but the position has given me a sense of freedom. I can, at last, approach the President and say, point blank..."How 'bout a little nukie?" I will have performed a valuable service for this troubled nation. Shall we dance, madame?
The feet are very underrated. People never pay much attention to their feet. I think it's very important to keep them in tip-top shape.

[Julie Messinger dreams her husband]
I didn't want to tell you this... I don't know quite how but... honey, I strayed because you have lousy feet!

[looking at a nude photo of herself]
Amazing! I bear a very striking resemblance to a nude woman!

[at the wedding gown store]
Richard, really! Most husbands don't have the time let alone the interest to do this.
That's because most husbands don't intend to dress up in their wife's clothes. Take it, we'll look wonderful in it.

Richard Messinger, the bestselling author of a famous children's novel, editor of a beloved New York picture magazine. Rich in comparison with the poor. Brilliant in comparison with the moderately intelligent. Happy in comparison with the glum. Dead at the tender age of 30 only after being put into comparison with the living!
And those foolish people in the ghettos think they have problems!
Richard, "horny" isn't even the word to describe what I feel right now. I just thought it would... I just thought it would be nice.
Honey, a gift isn't a gift just because you decide to give it. You could give someone a grand piano. They would appreciate the gesture, but couldn't accept it because...
...because he couldn't play the piano?
No. Because... his apartment is too small. You're upset now, aren't you?
No, I'm not. I just don't know what I'm gonna do with my grand piano.

[cuddling up to her]
I love you, honey!
[pushes her away]
Now, get on your side of the bed... and let a man with only a few more hours to live get some sleep!

[yelling at an unconscious man]
Mr. Messinger! Mr. Messinger! MR. MESSINGER! Dr. Spector, I'm not having much luck. Why don't you give it a try...
Certainly... RICHARD! RICHARD! RICHARD!
Jesus, is this what you do to someone in intensive care? Scream at him until he wakes up?
We do anything and everything in intensive care that might help, Mrs. Messinger.

[giving it a whirl]
RICHARD! RICHARD!

[after reading her husband's little black book, to herself]
Well, Richard! You've really have screwed us all, haven't you?
Are you here to give blood or are you the caterer?
Have you ever had venereal disease?
No, I've never even been in the tropics!
Richard, it's not my fault you can't eat because of your surgery. I've made everything you like. The least you can do is to stick around and see what you're missing. I've slaved making this meal!

[reading an ad in his magazine]
What is this? The Third World Film Festival? A great Libyan classic? This has to be some sort of joke.
Richard, let's not go through fifteen minutes of jokes about the Third World Film Festival.
Well, I'm just bewildered. Why are all these countries black or Oriental... and where are Sweden and Denmark?

Sweden and Denmark are not uncommited nations. All countries with a predominantly black population are uncomitted. All countries with a predominantly white population are A-OK. That's how we know which countries to invade.

[talking to her unconscious husband]
Richard, c'mon, wake up. It was a good joke at first, but now it's starting to wear thin. Listen, look at me, you prick, or so help me I'm going to divorce you!
Okay, now that we have your signature, we can start to assault Richard's gallbladder.
How do you beat the shit out of a guy who's been screwing your girlfriend for a year and then goes into a hepatic coma?
I guess you do what you did, Cal. You beat the shit out of his wife!
We have never been particularly Jewish. We've never been particularly anything... except well-groomed.
I don't like rodents. I was the only one in my science class who enjoyed seeing mice die. Not out of malice, you understand, but because, to me, it meant one less mouse in the world.
So, would you like to complete your day by having sex with a physician?
Certainly. Do you mind parking on the street?
I'm sorry, but if you don't have a garage, it's out of the question.
Damn it!
How do I look?
Julie, he's unconscious!
I know, but I wanna look nice.

[looking at her husband's black book]
Doria Perkins. Three times post... posterior. Three times posterior! I guess that's better than looking at her nose.
